page.title: 04Barton C.E. School
page.content:
Close to St Lawrence's Church stands the old school in which is a stone tablet which reads:"This building for the instruction of the young in piety and usefulness was erected in memory of George Jacson,Esq.1848".
The new school lies to the north of the church and is seperated from it by Barton Grange Hotel and Garden Centre. The school was opened in 1960. It has its own playing field alongside Garstang Road and the main entrance is in Jepps Avenue.
Closure of the school has recently been suggested by a working party set up by Lancashire County Council but the school will be open as usual on the first day of term in September 1985.
